Completion Prompts: Capture one early signal you noticed today and plan how to track it.
Identify one pattern from today's session and consider its potential impact.
Choose one small action to test an emerging pattern this week.

Overall Outcomes.Excellent: You regularly map emerging signals and test their implications → The future positions you ahead of shifts with informed, timely action.
Overall Outcomes.Expected: You notice some emerging patterns but act on them inconsistently → The future captures partial opportunities and mitigates some risks.
Overall Outcomes.Poor: You ignore or dismiss early signals → The future surprises you with avoidable crises or missed opportunities.
Overall Outcomes.Transcendent: Mapping emerging patterns is embedded in your culture → The future consistently shapes its environment rather than being shaped by it.

Overall Purpose: To make visible the signals, shifts, and possibilities that are beginning to take shape—before they become fixed—so choices can be made with clarity and alignment.

Guiding Questions: What small changes have I noticed recently?
Could these be early signs of a larger shift?
How might I track them without overreacting?
Themes.Name: Spotting Early Signals

Excellent.30-90 day system effect: Shifts are met with readiness and agility.
Excellent.Example moves: Maintaining a signal log reviewed monthly.
Excellent.Future effect: The future positions you ahead of shifts with informed, timely action.
Excellent.Present pattern: You systematically scan for early signals.
Excellent.Signals: Regular identification of trends before they accelerate.

Expected.Example moves: Following one emerging trend but missing related shifts.
Expected.Future effect: The future captures partial opportunities and mitigates some risks.
Expected.Immediate cost: Some opportunities are captured; others are missed.
Expected.Present pattern: You occasionally pick up on early signals.

Poor.Example moves: Ignoring a small but consistent customer complaint trend.
Poor.Future effect: The future surprises you with avoidable crises or missed opportunities.
Poor.Immediate cost: You miss the chance to act early.
Poor.Present pattern: You notice only the most obvious shifts.
Poor.Signals: Frequent surprise at market or internal developments.

Transcendent.30-90 day system effect: Consistent anticipation of shifts across the team.
Transcendent.Example moves: Embedding signal spotting in team rituals.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future consistently shapes its environment rather than being shaped by it.
Transcendent.Present pattern: Early signal awareness is cultural and constant.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To detect faint indicators of change before they become obvious.
Themes.Why This Matters: Weak signals often appear long before major shifts—they’re easier to influence early.

Guiding Questions: What story might they be telling?
What would it mean if this pattern continues?
Themes.Name: Connecting Signals into Patterns

Excellent.Edge condition: Not forcing patterns where none exist.
Excellent.Future effect: The future moves ahead with integrated, systemic insight.
Excellent.Present pattern: You intentionally map signals into patterns.
Excellent.Signals: Visual maps or summaries of pattern clusters.

Expected.Example moves: Spotting a trend in one product line but missing cross-market links.
Expected.Future effect: The future captures some opportunities but misses deeper shifts.
Expected.Immediate cost: Occasional clarity, but some patterns go unnoticed.
Expected.Present pattern: You sometimes connect signals into patterns.

Poor.Future effect: The future reacts without understanding the bigger picture.
Poor.Present pattern: You treat each signal as isolated.

Transcendent.30-90 day system effect: Shifts are shaped with strategic influence.
Transcendent.Edge condition: Balancing pattern recognition with openness to new data.
Transcendent.Example moves: Team-wide review of live pattern dashboards.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future consistently shapes patterns to its advantage.
Transcendent.Present pattern: Pattern mapping is embedded in all sensing work.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To link individual observations into coherent emerging narratives.
Themes.Why This Matters: A single signal can be noise; patterns tell a story worth acting on.

Guiding Questions: What’s the smallest test we could run on this pattern?
How will we measure the result?
Themes.Name: Testing the Implications

Excellent.Example moves: A/B testing responses to emerging trends.
Excellent.Future effect: The future allocates resources effectively toward validated shifts.
Excellent.Present pattern: You run structured tests to explore implications.

Expected.Future effect: The future makes some informed bets but still wastes resources.

Poor.30-90 day system effect: Loss of confidence in sensing process.
Poor.Example moves: Launching a major initiative based on a hunch.
Poor.Future effect: The future suffers avoidable false starts.
Poor.Present pattern: You act fully on untested patterns.

Transcendent.30-90 day system effect: The system adapts with precision and confidence.
Transcendent.Edge condition: Avoiding testing for its own sake.
Transcendent.Example moves: Integrating test-and-learn cycles into sensing workflow.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future shapes itself from well-tested emerging possibilities.
Transcendent.Present pattern: Testing implications is a default practice.
Transcendent.Signals: Consistent high win-rate from emerging bets.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To explore the possible outcomes of emerging patterns.
Themes.Why This Matters: Testing reduces the risk of overcommitting to unproven trends.

Guiding Questions: What are 3 different ways this could play out?
What signals would point to each path?
How can we prepare for all without overextending?
Themes.Name: Considering Multiple Possible Futures

Excellent.Example moves: Running scenario workshops for emerging patterns.
Excellent.Future effect: The future adapts fluidly to multiple possible paths.
Excellent.Present pattern: You explore a range of plausible futures.
Excellent.Signals: Scenario maps linked to emerging patterns.

Expected.Example moves: Identifying a 'plan B' without exploring further options.
Expected.Future effect: The future navigates change with partial agility.
Expected.Immediate cost: Some flexibility, but still anchored to a main assumption.

Poor.Example moves: Planning for only the most likely scenario.
Poor.Future effect: The future forces reactive course changes.
Poor.Present pattern: You assume only one outcome is possible.
Poor.Signals: Surprise when patterns deviate from expectations.

Transcendent.30-90 day system effect: High adaptability without loss of focus.
Transcendent.Edge condition: Avoiding diffusion of effort across too many scenarios.
Transcendent.Example moves: Maintaining living future maps updated quarterly.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future thrives across varied conditions.
Transcendent.Present pattern: Multiple futures thinking is embedded in planning.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To imagine different ways an emerging pattern could unfold.
Themes.Why This Matters: Considering multiple futures prevents overcommitment to one vision.

Guiding Questions: What’s the smallest meaningful action we could take?
How can this action influence the trajectory?
What support would make this action effective?
Themes.Name: Translating Insight into Action

Excellent.30-90 day system effect: Consistent shaping of trends to your advantage.
Excellent.Edge condition: Ensuring timing balances boldness with readiness.
Excellent.Example moves: Launching a pilot in an emerging market segment.
Excellent.Future effect: The future reflects your intentional influence.
Excellent.Present pattern: You act early and strategically on mapped patterns.

Expected.Example moves: Testing a feature after a competitor’s launch.
Expected.Future effect: The future shapes itself with partial input from you.
Expected.Immediate cost: Some influence, but many opportunities pass by.
Expected.Present pattern: You take tentative action on some patterns.

Poor.30-90 day system effect: Competitors or external forces set the direction.
Poor.Example moves: Delaying action until customer demand is fully proven.
Poor.Future effect: The future is shaped by others, not by you.
Poor.Immediate cost: Opportunities to shape the outcome are lost.
Poor.Present pattern: You wait until patterns fully mature before acting.
Poor.Signals: Consistently late entry into emerging spaces.

Transcendent.30-90 day system effect: Long-term positioning strengthens with each cycle.
Transcendent.Edge condition: Avoiding overreach before proof of viability.
Transcendent.Example moves: Embedding early-action protocols in strategy playbooks.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future consistently aligns with your intended direction.
Transcendent.Present pattern: Early, strategic action is standard practice.

Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To turn emerging understanding into steps that shape outcomes.
Themes.Why This Matters: Action taken early in a pattern’s life can influence its trajectory.

Title: Mapping What’s Emerging
When To Use This Protocol: Use when entering a new market, after a significant shift, or when multiple possible futures are present and you need to clarify direction.
Why This Matters: Early sensing allows you to shape the direction rather than just respond to it. Without mapping, you may overlook key signals or miss the chance to influence outcomes while they’re still forming.
